---
title: 'Environment variables'
description: "Reference for variables used in backend and service templates"
---

Xorq ships `.env.{service}.template` files (in the package `env_templates` directory) as blueprints for configuration. Profiles reference these variables (e.g. `${POSTGRES_HOST}`); you set the values in your environment or in a local `.env` file that is not committed. See [Profiles](profiles_api.qmd) for how references are used at connection time.

## Template reference

Variables defined in each `.env.{service}.template` file. Set values in your environment or in a local `.env` file that is not committed.

### PostgreSQL (`.env.postgres.template`)

Connection parameters for PostgreSQL.

| Variable | Description | Required |
|----------|-------------|----------|
| `POSTGRES_USER` | Database username | Yes |
| `POSTGRES_PASSWORD` | Database password | Yes |
| `POSTGRES_HOST` | Host address | Yes |
| `POSTGRES_PORT` | Port number | Yes |
| `POSTGRES_DATABASE` | Database name | Yes |

### AWS (`.env.aws.template`)

Amazon Web Services authentication and configuration.

| Variable | Description | Required |
|----------|-------------|----------|
| `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID` | Access key identifier | Yes |
| `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY` | Secret access key | Yes |
| `AWS_SESSION_TOKEN` | Session token (temporary credentials) | No |
| `AWS_ALLOW_HTTP` | Allow HTTP (not recommended for production) | No |
| `AWS_REGION` | Region for services | Yes |

Do not commit credentials. Prefer IAM roles or temporary credentials when possible.

### Snowflake (`.env.snowflake.template`)

Snowflake data warehouse connection parameters.

| Variable | Description | Required |
|----------|-------------|----------|
| `SNOWFLAKE_USER` | Username | Yes |
| `SNOWFLAKE_PASSWORD` | Password | Yes |
| `SNOWFLAKE_ACCOUNT` | Account identifier | Yes |
| `SNOWFLAKE_ROLE` | Role to assume | Yes |
| `SNOWFLAKE_WAREHOUSE` | Warehouse to use | Yes |
| `SNOWFLAKE_DATABASE` | Database name | No |
| `SNOWFLAKE_SCHEMA` | Schema name | No |
| `SNOWFLAKE_PRIVATE_KEY` | Private key (key-pair auth) | No |
| `SNOWFLAKE_PUBLIC_KEY` | Public key (key-pair auth) | No |
| `SNOWFLAKE_PRIVATE_KEY_PWD` | Passphrase for private key | No |
| `SNOWFLAKE_CREATE_OBJECT_UDFS` | Create object UDFs on connect | No |

### Weather API (`.env.weather.template`)

OpenWeatherMap API integration.

| Variable | Description | Required |
|----------|-------------|----------|
| `OPENWEATHER_API_KEY` | OpenWeatherMap API key | Yes |

### PyIceberg (`.env.pyiceberg.template`)

Apache Iceberg catalog and warehouse configuration.

| Variable | Description | Required | Default |
|----------|-------------|----------|---------|
| `ICEBERG_WAREHOUSE_PATH` | Path to Iceberg warehouse | No | `warehouse` |
| `ICEBERG_NAMESPACE` | Default namespace for tables | No | `default` |
| `ICEBERG_CATALOG_NAME` | Catalog name | No | `default` |
| `ICEBERG_CATALOG_TYPE` | Catalog backend: `sql`, `hive`, or `glue` | No | `sql` |
| `ICEBERG_URI` | Connection URI for the catalog | Yes | â€” |

### Xorq (`.env.xorq.template`)

Core Xorq application settings (cache, profiles, debug).

| Variable | Description | Required | Default |
|----------|-------------|----------|---------|
| `XORQ_CACHE_DIR` | Directory for cached data | No | `~/.cache/xorq` |
| `XORQ_DEFAULT_RELATIVE_PATH` | Default relative path for data | No | `parquet` |
| `XORQ_PROFILE_DIR` | Directory for stored profiles | No | `~/.config/xorq/profiles` |
| `XORQ_DEBUG` | Enable debug mode | No | `False` |
| `XORQ_CACHE_KEY_PREFIX` | Prefix for cache keys | No | `letsql_cache-` |

Set these as shell environment variables (e.g. with `export` in your shell or in a `.env` file loaded by your app).
